metadata.title: CVE-2017-5074 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in Chrome Apps in Google Chrome prior to 59.0.3071.86 forWindows allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory readvia a crafted HTML page, related to Bluetooth.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
